Landgren
May Allen

Born: October 3, 1888 (7, 8)

Birthplace: Rockford, Winnebago County, Illinois (7, 8)

Mother: Sarah Sheffield (1, 7, 8)

Father: William Allen (1, 7, 8)

Husband: Robert Collins (2, 3, 4)

Married: March 21, 1914 (2)

Marriage Place: Lake County, Indiana (2)

Direct Descendant: Roberta Collins (3)

Death: November 21, 1934 (7, 8)

Death Place: Rockford, Winnebago County, Illinois (7, 8)

Burial: November 23, 1934 (7, 8)

Burial Place: Greenwood Cemetery, Rockford, Winnebago County, Illinois (7, 8)

May Allen is born on the 3rd of October, 1888 to William Allen and Sarah Sheffield in Rockford, Winnebago County, Illinois (1, 7, 8). At age 9 the family is living at 903 West State St (1).

On the 21st of March, 1914 May Allen married Robert Collins in Lake County, Indiana, just across the Illinois/Indiana Border up by Chicago (2). In 1917, he is drafted in World War I. His draft card records the couple as living at 1006 Kelburn in Rockford, as does the directory the following year (4, 5). During that time they have their first child, Roberta Collins ([3(#3)).

By 1920, they are living at 714 Chestnut in Rockford (3). By 1924, they have moved to 1019 Peach, Rockford (4). Sometime between 1926 (when they are recorded as married in the city directory (#4)) and 1930, the two divorce. By 1930 she is married to Henry C Delaney, and the two of them are raising Mary and Doris from her marriage with Robert. The family is living at North Court Street, Rockford (6).

Four years later she dies on the 21st of November, 1934 (7, 8). She is buried in Greenwood Cemetery, Rockford.
